snippet: Small ceramic indoor stoves do save fuel and cut down on eye-irritating smoke, a new study has found — but they do not save children from pneumonia.
abstract: Study in The American Journal of Tropical Medicine and Hygiene finds that small ceramic stoves used in some African households save fuel and cut down on eye-irritating smoke but do not save children from pneumonia.
lead_paragraph: Small ceramic indoor stoves do save fuel and cut down on eye-irritating smoke, a new study has found — but they do not save children from pneumonia.
